arabicText: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَیۡلࣱ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِینَ

translations.en: WOE UNTO THOSE who give short measure:
translations.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَیۡلࣱ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِینَ

arabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ یَسۡتَوۡفُونَ

translations.en: those who, when they are to receive their due from [other] people, demand that it be given in full –
translations.ar: ٱلَّذِینَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ یَسۡتَوۡفُونَ

translations.en: but when they have to measure or weigh whatever they owe to others, give less than what is due!
Do they not know that they are bound to be raised from the dead
[and called to account] on an awesome Day –
the Day when all men shall stand before the Sustainer of all the worlds?

arabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِی سِجِّینࣲ

translations.en: NAY, VERILY, the record of the wicked is indeed [set down] in a mode inescapable!
translations.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِی سِجِّینࣲ

translations.en: And what could make thee conceive what that that mode inescapable will be?
A record [indelibly] inscribed!
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –
those who give the lie to the [coming of] Judgment Day:

arabicText: وَمَا یُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦۤ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِیمٍ

translations.en: for, none gives the lie to it but such as are wont to transgress against all that is [and are] immersed in sin:
translations.ar: وَمَا یُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦۤ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِیمٍ

arabicText: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَیۡهِ ءَایَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِیرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ

translations.en: [and so,] whenever Our messages are conveyed to them, they but say, "Fables of ancient times!"
translations.ar: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَیۡهِ ءَایَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِیرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ

arabicText: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ یَكۡسِبُونَ

translations.en: Nay, but their hearts are corroded by all [the evil] that they were wont to do!
translations.ar: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ یَكۡسِبُونَ

arabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ

translations.en: Nay, verily, from [the grace of] their Sustainer shall they on that Day be debarred;
translations.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ

translations.en: and then, behold, they shall enter the blazing fire

arabicText: ثُمَّ یُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِی كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

translations.en: and be told: "This is the [very thing] to which you were wont to give the lie!"
translations.ar: ثُمَّ یُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِی كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

arabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِی عِلِّیِّینَ

translations.en: NAY, VERILY - the record of the truly virtuous is [set down] in a mode most lofty!
translations.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِی عِلِّیِّینَ

translations.en: And what could make thee conceive what that mode most lofty will be?
A record [indelibly] inscribed,
witnessed~ by all who have [ever] been drawn close unto God.
Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous will indeed be in bliss:
[resting on couches, they will look up [to God]:
upon their faces thou wilt see the brightness of bliss.
They will be given a drink of pure wine whereon the seal [of God] will have been set,

arabicText: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكࣱۚ وَفِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَلۡیَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ

translations.en: pouring forth with a fragrance of musk. To that [wine of paradise], then, let all such aspire as [are willing to] aspire to things of high account:
translations.ar: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكࣱۚ وَفِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَلۡیَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ

translations.en: for it is composed of all that is most exalting
a source [of bliss] whereof those who are drawn close unto God shall drink.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ أَجۡرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ یَضۡحَكُونَ

translations.en: BEHOLD, those who have abandoned themselves to sin are wont to laugh at such as have attained to faith
translations.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ أَجۡرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ یَضۡحَكُونَ

translations.en: and whenever they pass by them, they wink at one another [derisively];

arabicText: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِینَ

translations.en: and whenever they return to people of their own kind, they return full of jests;
translations.ar: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِینَ

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰۤؤُلَاۤءِ لَضَاۤلُّونَ

translations.en: and whenever they see those [who believe,] they say, "Behold, these [people] have indeed gone astray!"
translations.ar: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰۤؤُلَاۤءِ لَضَاۤلُّونَ

translations.en: And, withal, they have no call to watch over [the beliefs of] others...

arabicText: فَٱلۡیَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ یَضۡحَكُونَ

translations.en: But on the Day [of Judgment], they who had attained to faith will [be able to] laugh at the [erstwhile] deniers of the truth:
translations.ar: فَٱلۡیَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ یَضۡحَكُونَ

translations.en: [for, resting in paradise] on couches, they will look on [and say to themselves]:

arabicText: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ یَفۡعَلُونَ

translations.en: "Are these deniers of the truth being [thus] requited for [aught but] what they were wont to do?"
translations.ar: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ یَفۡعَلُونَ
